modules.description: Defines and manipulates logging severity levels with support for string conversion. Works with the `t` variant type representing levels like `Trace`, `Debug`, `Info`, and `Error`. Used to set and interpret log verbosity from configuration or command line inputs.

Converts time values to human-readable strings and adjusts timezone offsets according to RFC 3339. Works with `Ptime.t` and `Ptime.tz_offset_s` types. Useful for formatting log timestamps with correct timezone information.

This module provides functions for logging messages at different severity levels, such as `trace`, `debug`, `info`, and `error`, each accepting either a string or a thunk that produces a string. It works with logging levels defined in the `Level` module and supports custom output functions like `prerr_endline` or asynchronous alternatives. Concrete use cases include selectively logging diagnostic information to stderr, stdout, or custom destinations based on runtime verbosity settings.

This module combines logging and time formatting functionality. It allows logging messages at various severity levels to customizable outputs, supporting both direct strings and lazy evaluation thunks. It also converts time values to RFC 3339-compliant strings, particularly for enriching log entries with correctly formatted timestamps.
